title: [$250] Expense - Distance rate is different on confirm page, expense preview and transaction thread

labels.description: This issue or pull request should block deployment

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Hourly

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

labels.name: DeployBlocker
labels.description: Indicates it should block deploying the API

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.20-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71319 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** josdjnoijsoijdsojis@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Account default currency is USD. - Account has no workspace. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a non-USD workspace (EUR). 3. Go to self DM. 4. Click + > Track distance > Manual. 5. Enter distance > Next. → On confirm page, the rate is $0.7 / mile. 6. Click Create expense. → On expense preview, the rate is $0.7 / mile. 7. Open the transaction thread. ## Expected Result: Rate field will show $0.7 / mile. ## Actual Result: Rate field shows $0.3 / mile (for EUR workspace). ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b3a267a8-0774-44bc-be33-4525fd37a604 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create two workspaces. 3. Delete the workspace that has Default label. 4. Go to workspace chat. 5. Create an empty report. 6. Go to self DM. 7. Track a manual expense. 8. Open the transaction thread. 9. Click Report. ## Expected Result: Report field will open report list because there is an open report. ## Actual Result: Report field opens Upgrade page when there is an open report. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/07e5d766-3df3-4227-9c63-4fe3638d3162 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.20-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/71474 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdoijsdnoisjniojs@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.expensify.com 2. Create an unreported distance expense (Report field is none) with the following waypoints: Start - 88 kearny street Stop - Golden gate bridge 3. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 4. Go to self DM. 5. Go to transaction thread of the expense created in Step 2. 6. Go back to self DM. ## Expected Result: There will be no extra expense preview after creating unreported distance expense from OD. ## Actual Result: There is an extra expense preview which loads infinitely after creating unreported distance expense from OD. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e16103db-fe98-4619-be16-8ad1cdfcd8da [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

Disable **Workflows** in the workspace. 2. Create a new **Report**. 3. Notice the "next steps" message displayed, and then disappearing after a short while. 4. Create a new **Expense** within the report. 5. Again, a "next steps" message appears and then disappears after a short while. ## Expected Result: Next steps disabled without any issue ## Actual Result: "Next steps" messages appear and disappear when Workflows are disabled ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.19-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Edge Cases - Issue to retest https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/58234 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** **App Component:** ## Action Performed: 1. Login to any account 2. Go to Account and select any Workspace -> Members and select a member, Right click on the email field 3. Select Profile and Right click on the email field 4. Go to any Workspace not owned by the user, Right click on the address field 5. Go to any paid report, with a merchant provided, Right click on the merchant field 6. Go to any paid distance expense, Right click on the distance, rate and date fields 7. Go to settings -> Wallet, open the card under Assigned cards, reveal the details and Right click on the card number field ## Expected Result: All these instances are copiable using the right click pattern. ## Actual Result: Instances are not copiable using the right click ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e104f538-4566-4e23-a47b-87bf127dd568 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Wallet - Blank popup on selecting Transfer balance option when BA has Business bank account

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.19-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** Exploratory **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.78+ck92725@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: User logged in with gmail account & has created new workspace 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Navigate to WS settings >> Workflows >> Make & track payments 3. Add VBA (Regions bank) going through plaid flow 4. Navigate to Accounts >> Wallet >> click Enable wallet 5. Go through the enable wallet flow 6. Tap on Transfer balance option 7. Observe blank popup displayed ## Expected Result: Transfer balance page RHP (or if popup appears, it should display relevant info) should be displayed when wallet has added business bank account ## Actual Result: Blank popup on selecting Transfer balance option when BA has only Business bank account. Issue happens when wallet has only business bank account Note: If bank account has both Personal BA & Business BA, transfer balance RHP opens as expected on selecting transfer balance option. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/0d5ef31e-6718-42f4-82aa-4cf099cfbc64 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
